headline: Рубль утром тяготеет к росту с учетом близкого ЕНП
News:
МОСКВА, 26 мар (Рейтер) - Рубль утром среды показывает
положительные изменения на форексе с учетом послезавтрашнего
Единого налогового платежа, под который российские экспортеры
могут допродавать валютную выручку.
    В фокусе внимания остается и волатильная геополитическая
новостная повестка, в частности, может оценивается вероятность
перемирия между Украиной и Россией в свете прошедших на текущей
неделе переговоров США с обеими сторонами конфликта, а также
свежие комментарии Дональда Трампа о желании Москвы и Киева
достичь мира.
    Надежды на скорое завершение украинского конфликта и
ожидания улучшения отношений между Москвой и Вашингтоном с
последующей возможностью ослабления американских санкций против
России при республиканской администрации США выступают в
последние месяцы основной внеэкономической поддержкой рублю.
    Пара доллар/рубль <RUB=> к 9.20 МСК котировалась на форексе
по 83,65, у рубль набирает 1,2% от уровней закрытия вторника, по
итогам которого рубль подешевел против доллара на 0,9%, согласно
данным LSEG.
    Пара евро/рубль <EURRUB=> котируется по 90,60, и рубль
дорожает на 0,1% от закрытия вторника, по итогам которого
российская валюта ослабела против европейской на 0,8%.
    Пара юань/рубль <CNYRUB=> сейчас находится на форексе у
отметки 11,15  против 12,19 при закрытии вторника, согласно
данным LSEG.
    Вчерашние торги Мосбиржи парой юань/рубль расчетами "завтра"
завершились на уровне 11,48 рубля за юань - российская валюта в
о вторник выросла на 1% при объеме сделок в 90 миллиардов
рублей, что на 1/5 меньше показателя предыдущей торговой сессии.
    Рубль накануне показал смешанную итоговую динамику при
приглушенном геополитическом новостном фоне, немного снизившим
оптимизм в отношении российской валюты на внешних рынках, но
одновременно при поддержке на локальном рынке фактора
предстоящих налоговых выплат, к которым сырьевые компании
продают экспортную выручку, при этом импортеры во вторник были
менее активны в покупках валюты, чем днем ранее.
    В пятницу пройдут налоговые выплаты, при этом в текущем
месяце сырьевые корпорации проводят окончательные расчеты с
бюджетом за прошлый год, в том числе уплачивают налог на
дополнительный доход за четвертый квартал почти на полтриллиона
рублей, что еще может поддержать курс российской валюты в
ближайшие дни, однако продажи экспортной выручки под расчеты с
бюджетом достаточно дискретны и малопредсказуемы.
    На внешнем контуре поддержкой рублю выступает рынок нефти,
где базовые сорта котируются недалеко от достигнутых накануне
трехнедельных максимумов. Североморская смесь Brent <LCOc1>
дорожает на 0,1% и оценивается в $73,26 за баррель, а во вторник
она стоила $73,57 впервые с 3 марта, 
    На форексе индекс доллара оценивается в 104,34 <=USD>, что
на 0,1% выше последних вчерашних значений. Пара евро/доллар
котируется вблизи $1,0782 <EUR=>, на 0,1% ниже закрытия
вторника.
    Китайский юань теряет 0,1% на континентальном рынке КНР
(7,2645) <CNY=> и столько же - на офшорном (7,2735) <CNH=>.
    

 (Московское бюро)
 ((moscow.newsroom@thomsonreuters.com))

headline: Yuan wobbles near 2-week low on tariff, growth concerns
News:
By Jiaxing Li
       HONG KONG, March 26 (Reuters) - China's yuan languished
near a two-week low against the dollar on Wednesday, pressured
by concerns over the economic impact of U.S. tariffs and the
threat of more duties on Chinese goods. 
    By 0300 GMT, the yuan <CNY=CFXS> was 0.07% lower at 7.2643
to the dollar, its weakest level since March 10.
    The offshore yuan traded at 7.2712 yuan per dollar <CNH=>,
down about 0.06% in Asian trade. 
    Markets remain on tenterhooks as they look ahead to next
week, when U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to announce
more tariffs targeting auto and chips industries. 
    China's economic growth is likely to moderate in the second
quarter as the U.S. tariff impact deepens and the effect of the
current stimulus fades, said Ju Wang, head of FX and rates
strategy for Greater China at BNP Paribas, in a note to clients.
    The People's Bank of China earlier this week said that it
will issue 450 billion yuan of one-year medium-term lending
facility, which will alleviate the local banks' funding
pressures slightly, she added.
    "This nuanced monetary easing bias could add to the RMB's
near-term weakness." 
    Prior to the market opening, the PBOC set the midpoint rate
<CNY=PBOC>, around which the yuan is allowed to trade in a 2%
band, at 7.1754 per dollar, 805 pips firmer than a Reuters'
estimate.
    The Chinese yuan has risen 0.3% against the dollar this
month and is up 0.5% year-to-date, as the dollar rally loses
momentum with the fading of the U.S. exceptionalism trade. 
    The dollar's six-currency index <=USD> inched higher to
104.27 on Wednesday. It dipped to a five-month low of 103.19
last week, weighed down by worries that Trump's trade war could
trigger a U.S. recession. 
    Chinese government 10-year bond yields <CN10YT=RR> fell 0.7
basis point to 1.89%. The yield on similar U.S. government
benchmark debt was 4.3%. The yuan onshore 7-day benchmark repo
rate was at 1.94%.
Key onshore vs offshore levels:
 * Overnight dollar/yuan swap onshore -5.05 pips vs. offshore
-5.05
 * Three-month SHIBOR <SHIBOR=> 1.9 % vs. 3-month CNH HIBOR 2.1%
   

 (Reporting by Jiaxing Li in Hong Kong
Editing by Shri Navaratnam)
 ((Jiaxing.Li@thomsonreuters.com; +852 34627725;))

headline: 中国汇市：人民币早盘小幅下探逾半个月新低，4月对等关税实施前市场偏谨慎
News:
* 
      人民币早盘创半个月，CNH触及三周低点
    

        * 
      中间价实际值和路透预测偏离仍逾800点
    

        * 
      4月对等关税实施前，人民币或以稳为主
    

        * 
      跨季资金需求扰动美元/人民币短端掉期
    

  

       路透上海3月26日 - 人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周三早盘下探逾半个月新低，半日波幅仍仅50余点，离岸CNH <CNH=D3>盘中下探三周新低，中间价结束四连回到近一周高点，和路透预测偏离则仍超800点。美国对等关税实施在即，市场情绪略偏谨慎，短期人民币料以稳为主，等待更多指引。
    
    交易员表示，4月2日美国对等关税如何实施，将决定美元走向，人民币也可能面临新的选择。跨季需求扰动银行间人民币资金价格仍偏贵，这使得美元/人民币短端掉期<CNYTN=CFXS>继续反弹，而长端掉期的套利买需不减也让曲线变得更平。
    
    “美元能反弹多高不好说，人民币应该也没什么空间了，等4月2日关税实施后市场怎么反应再说，”一外资行交易员称。
    
    
    隔夜美国公布的消费者信心指数在3月份骤降至四年多来最低，反映出家庭对未来可能出现的经济衰退以及因关税引发的通胀的担忧日益加剧。该调查的未来预期指数创下了12年来的新低，并突破了与经济衰退相关的水平。
    
    招商银行金融市场部最新观点认为，近期美国公布的几项软数据依然表现疲弱，延续了上月趋势，“滞胀”担忧预计在4月初关税主题结束后继续发酵。
    
    特朗普总统反复无常的关税政策遭到了经济学家们的抨击，他们认为特朗普的关税政策造成了混乱和不确定性，使企业难以提前规划，不利于经济发展。
    
    周五的美国个人消费支出价格指数（美联储首选的通胀指标）将是重头戏。根据一致预测，该指数将保持稳定，但远高于美联储2%的目标。
    
    
    全球汇市方面，美元周三稍作喘息，美国消费者信心数据疲软和对大规模关税对美国经济增长影响的担忧，抑制了美元近期的反弹走势。[FRX/CN]
    
    北京时间11:30，人民币兑美元<CNY=CFXS>即期报7.2648元，盘中最低触及7.2653元，创3月10日以来新低，上日收报7.264元，夜盘终报7.2593元。今日人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>报7.1754元，上日为7.1788元。截至目前人民币即期成交量<CNYSPTVOL=CFXT>为159.08亿美元。

    海外无本金交割远期外汇(NDF)<CNYNDFOR=>市场上，美元/人民币一年期品种<CNY1YNDFOR=>最新报在7.0925元, 上日尾盘为7.0855元。香港的离岸人民币兑美元即期<CNH=D3>最新报在7.2731元, 盘中最低触及7.2741元，创3月5日以来新低，当前汇价与在岸即期价差为83点，上一交易日尾盘报7.2664元。（完）
    
    相关报导：

headline: 中国汇市：路透测算的人民币汇率CFETS指数持平于98.93，上日曾触及半个月高位
News:
路透上海3月26日 - 路透根据中国外汇交易中心(CFETS)公布的中间价测算，CFETS
人民币汇率指数周三持平于98.93，上日该指数触及半个月高位；SDR篮子指数微升至93.09
，BIS篮子指数微跌至105.18。

    今年以来CFETS人民币汇率指数累计下跌2.50%，SDR篮子指数跌1.53%，BIS指数跌1.90%
。2024年这三个指数分别升4.16%、1.41%和4.69%。2023年这三个指数分别跌1.27%、2.97%
和1.21%，但跌幅较2022年均有收窄，2022年这三个指数分别跌3.71%、4.25%和2.80%。

    为便于市场成员和社会公众获取CFETS人民币汇率指数系列数据，自2016年2月22日起，
CFETS在中国货币网新增人民币汇率指数展示功能，并按周和按月发布人民币汇率指数数据
。

    2016年底CFETS进行首次货币篮子规则调整，CFETS篮子货币数量由13种调升为24种，同
时调整了相关货币权重；SDR篮子也调整了货币权重，并与CFETS货币篮子均重新定基，重新
定基日为2016年最后一个交易日。

    2019年底开始交易中心每年年末都对CFETS指数进行权重微调和重新定基，此举旨在进
一步增强指数的代表性。2024年底交易中心将CFETS指数货币篮子和权重都进行调整，篮子
货币总数增至25个。[nL4S3NW0I5]

    2022年底外汇交易中心对SDR指数货币权重进行微调。2019年底对BIS指数货币权重进行
微调；2023年底对BIS指数货币篮子和权重都进行了调整，BIS篮子货币数量调整为43种。（
完）

headline: 中国汇市：人民币兑美元中间价触近一周高点，和路透预测偏离则仍超800点
News:
路透上海3月26日 - 人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>周三报7.1754元，较上日的7.1788元小升34点，创3月20日以来新高，和路透预测偏离则仍超800点；隔夜美元和美债收益率小幅回落，人民币的外部压力略缓解，不过4月2日美国进一步关税实施前，人民币仍将跟随美元窄幅波动。

    人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>上日收盘报7.264元，夜盘终报7.2593元。离岸人民币即期<CNH=D3>最新报7.2685元，上日收盘在7.2664元。稍早前路透测算今日人民币中间价大概会开在7.2559元附近，较上日贬值约771点，“逆周期因子”暂未发生作用。
    

    隔夜美国公布的消费者信心指数在3月份骤降至四年多来最低，反映出家庭对未来可能出现的经济衰退以及因关税引发的通胀的担忧日益加剧。该调查的未来预期指数创下了12年来的新低，并突破了与经济衰退相关的水平。
    
    特朗普总统反复无常的关税政策遭到了经济学家们的抨击，他们认为特朗普的关税政策造成了混乱和不确定性，使企业难以提前规划，不利于经济发展。
    
    市场人士指出，4月2日美国对等关税如何实施，将决定美元走向，人民币也可能面临新的选择。
    
    
    周五的美国个人消费支出价格指数（美联储首选的通胀指标）将是重头戏。根据一致预测，该指数将保持稳定，但远高于美联储2%的目标。
    
    全球汇市方面，美元周三稍作喘息，美国消费者信心数据疲软和对大规模关税对美国经济增长影响的担忧，抑制了美元近期的反弹走势。[FRX/CN](完)

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

 ((Jindong.Zhang@thomsonreuters.com; +86 21 20830168; Reuters Messaging:
Jindong.Zhang.thomsonreuters.com@thomsonreuters.net))

headline: 人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>小升34点至7.1754元，创3月20日以来新高
News:
路透上海3月26日 - 人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>周三报7.1754元，较上日的7.1788元小升34点，创3月20日以来新高，和路透预测偏离则仍超800点；隔夜美元和美债收益率小幅回落，人民币的外部压力略缓解，不过4月2日美国进一步关税实施前，人民币仍将跟随美元窄幅波动。

    人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>上日收盘报7.264元，夜盘终报7.2593元。离岸人民币即期<CNH=D3>最新报7.2685元，上日收盘在7.2664元。稍早前路透测算今日人民币中间价大概会开在7.2559元附近，较上日贬值约771点，“逆周期因子”暂未发生作用。
    

    隔夜美国公布的消费者信心指数在3月份骤降至四年多来最低，反映出家庭对未来可能出现的经济衰退以及因关税引发的通胀的担忧日益加剧。该调查的未来预期指数创下了12年来的新低，并突破了与经济衰退相关的水平。
    
    特朗普总统反复无常的关税政策遭到了经济学家们的抨击，他们认为特朗普的关税政策造成了混乱和不确定性，使企业难以提前规划，不利于经济发展。
    
    市场人士指出，4月2日美国对等关税如何实施，将决定美元走向，人民币也可能面临新的选择。
    
    
    周五的美国个人消费支出价格指数（美联储首选的通胀指标）将是重头戏。根据一致预测，该指数将保持稳定，但远高于美联储2%的目标。
    
    全球汇市方面，美元周三稍作喘息，美国消费者信心数据疲软和对大规模关税对美国经济增长影响的担忧，抑制了美元近期的反弹走势。[FRX/CN](完)

headline: 路透测算的人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>今日料开在7.2559元附近
News:
路透上海3月26日 - 路透根据中国外汇交易中心(CFETS)公布的人民币汇率形成机制测算，人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>周三预计会开在7.2559元附近，较上日贬值约771点。
    
    隔夜美国公布的3月消费者信心连续第四个月下降，加上特朗普政府对关税的反复摇摆，美元和美债收益率隔夜小幅回落，人民币面临的外部压力略有缓解；但关税重压下人民币的贬值压力难消，监管层料延续对中间价单边预期的过滤举措，助力稳定市场预期。

    上日人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>收报7.264元，而中间价则为7.1788元。根据定价机制，今日中间价变动中，有852点下跌反映市场供求影响，另有81点上涨反映的是隔夜一篮子汇率基本保持不变所需要的点数；“逆周期因子”暂未发生作用。

    路透测算的上日人民币兑美元中间价为7.263元，和外汇交易中心公布的实际值偏差842点。上日路透根据CFETS公布的中间价测算，人民币汇率CFETS指数、参考SDR（特别提款权）篮子指数和参考BIS(国际清算银行)篮子指数分别为98.93、93.05和105.22。

    上日(截至北京时间次日凌晨3点)人民币兑美元即期累计成交量<CNYSPTVOL=CFXT>为449.83亿美元。

    2016年2月以来中国初步形成“收盘汇率+一篮子货币汇率变化”的人民币对美元汇率中间价形成机制，2017年2月将中间价对一篮子货币的参考时段由24小时调整为15小时，5月底外汇市场自律机制汇率工作组在中间价报价模型中引入“逆周期因子”。

    在2018年初自律机制建议各报价行“可以调整”报价模型中的“逆周期系数”，使其恢复中性；6月起人民币快速下跌，市场贬值预期再起，8月24日自律机制称重启逆周期因子。2020年10月部分报价行将逆周期因子淡出使用。(完)

 (发稿 张金栋；审校 张喜良)
 ((Jindong.Zhang@thomsonreuters.com; +86 21 20830168; Reuters Messaging:
Jindong.Zhang.thomsonreuters.com@thomsonreuters.net))

headline: 《汇市简讯》亚洲前瞻：聚焦地区市场走势、数据和日圆走强
News:
路透3月26日 - 美国周二与乌克兰和俄罗斯达成协议，俄乌同意在黑海停火并暂停对能源设施的袭击，但乌克兰总统表示，俄罗斯已经在操纵美国促成的协议。

    关税的不确定性导致美国消费者信心骤降至四年多来最低。

    华尔街周二小幅收高，美国公债收益率曲线趋陡，美元下滑，大宗商品走强。

    尽管新兴市场ETF下跌0.3%，但亚洲市场获得温和利好指引，日本服务业PPI和连锁店销售、澳洲CPI以及新加坡制造业产出是周三的主要经济数据。亚洲市场将重点关注地区市场走势、数据和日圆走强。

    尽管消费者信心指数下降，但受特朗普政府下周将采取更灵活贸易政策立场的希望支撑，道指收盘上涨 0.01%，标普500指数上涨 0.15%，纳指上涨 0.46%。
    
    美国公债收益率曲线趋陡，受消费者信心疲软影响，TradeWeb显示，两年期公债收益率跌2个基点至 4.017%，10 年期公债收益率跌2个基点至 4.315%，30年期公债收益率涨1个基点至 4.661%。

    油价走强，俄罗斯和乌克兰之间的海上和能源停火抵消了因美国威胁对购买委内瑞拉石油的国家征收关税而导致全球供应收紧的担忧，布兰特 原油期货涨0.25%，美国原油涨0.15%。美国期铜涨2.63%，因预期美国将对铜加征关税。金价涨0.25%，受特朗普关税担忧支撑。

    美元下滑0.1%，因短期美国公债收益率下降，引发日圆走强，美元/日圆跌0.5%。欧元跌0.1%，英镑涨0.15%，美元/离岸人民币涨0.05%，澳元涨0.25%，新西兰元涨0.05%，美元/加元跌0.3%。
    
    比特币在纽约下午 5 点时报87,881 美元，上涨0.42%。

    * President Xi expected to meet some on Friday [nL1N3Q007A]

headline: BUZZ-Asia Day Ahead-Focus on regional markets, data, yen strength
News:
March 26 (Reuters) - The United States reached deals on Tuesday with
Ukraine and Russia to pause attacks at sea and against energy targets, but
Ukraine's president said Russia is already manipulating the accords brokered by
the U.S.
    Tariff uncertainty caused U.S. consumer confidence to hit a four-year low.
    Wall Street edged higher, the Treasury curve steepened, the U.S. dollar
slipped, and commodities firmed on Tuesday.
    A modest positive lead for Asian markets, though EM ETFs eased 0.3%,
Japanese services PPI and chain store sales, Australian CPI, and Singapore's
manufacturing output lead Wednesday's data schedule. Asia will focus on regional
markets, data, and yen strength.
    Despite the fall in consumer confidence, the Dow closed +0.01%, S&P +0.15%,
and Nasdaq +0.46%, supported by hopes of a more flexible trade policy stance
from the Trump administration next week.
    The Treasury curve steepened in response to the weak consumer confidence,
2yr -2bp to 4.017%, 10yr -2bp to 4.315% and 30yr +1bp to 4.661% on TradeWeb.
    Oil firmed as Russia-Ukraine truce hopes offset Venezuela supply fears,
Brent +0.25% and WTI +0.15%. U.S. copper +2.63% on expected U.S. tariffs. Gold
+0.25%, supported by Trump tariff worries.
    The U.S. dollar slipped 0.1% with lower short-end Treasury yields, which
triggered yen strength, USD/JPY -0.5%. EUR -0.1%, GBP +0.15%, USD/CNH +0.05%,
AUD +0.25%, NZD +0.05%, and USD/CAD -0.3%.
    Bitcoin traded up 0.42% at $87,881 at 5 pm in New York.
    For more click on [FXBUZ]

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Andy    https://tmsnrt.rs/3Y57sh5
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^>
 (Andrew Spencer is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own.
Editing by Sonali Desai)
 ((Andrew.m.spencer@thomsonreuters.com))

headline: FX Market Calm On The Surface, Angst Below
News:
FX Market Calm On The Surface, Angst BelowMar 25, 2025

Image Source:?Pexels ?

Overview:? ?The US dollar is consolidating its recent gains against the G10 currencies in quiet and relatively uneventful turnover. There continue to be mixed signals about the US tariffs threatened for next week. President Trump himself said that auto tariffs were coming soon as in days, while suggesting that there may be "a lot" of carve-outs from the reciprocal tariffs. EU's trade representative Sefcovic is meeting with US Commerce Secretary Lutnick today and a US delegation is in India today to talk trade. The greenback mixed against emerging market currencies. The Mexican peso was the strongest yesterday, gaining 1% against the greenback and is marginally stronger today. Of note, the offshore yuan is lower for the sixth consecutive session, its longest losing streak in about 2 1/2 years and the PBOC set the dollar's reference rate higher for the fourth consecutive session. It seems to be signaling an acceptance of a weaker yuan, perhaps given the tariff threats, which were extended yesterday to include buying Venezuelan oil and gas.?

While most of the bourses in the Asia Pacific region rose, including Indonesia, where the weakness of the rupiah spurred central bank intervention today, the Hang Seng and mainland shares that trade there, tumbled more than 2%. The Stoxx 600 in Europe is trying to snap a three-day decline, while US index futures are paring yesterday's strong gains. Benchmark 10-year rates are 2-5 bp higher in Europe, while the 10-year US Treasury yield is edging higher for the third consecutive session. If sustained, it would be the longest advance this month and at 4.35%, it is the highest level since late February. Gold is firm, holding above $3000, but below yesterday's high ($3033). May WTI is extending yesterday's 1.2% advance at near $69.50 is at its best level since March 3 as it extends the rally into the fifth consecutive session.?

USD: ?The Dollar Index held last Friday's low in the yesterday's pullback and was better bid in North America. After falling from a peak near 110.20 on January 13, DXY has carved out a bottom this month near 103.20. It reached almost 104.45 yesterday and posted its highest close since March 3. It is trading firmly but quietly today between about 104.25-and 104.45. The 104.90-105.00 area still looks like a reasonable target in the coming days. Today's high frequency data includes house prices, new home sales, and the Philadelphia's Fed's non-manufacturing survey. Recall that the Philly Fed's business outlook reported last week pulled back to 12.5 from 18.1, its lowest reading in Q1. The optimism of January (44.30) has faded. The Conference Board's measure of consumer for March will be reported, but the question is not so much the direction (down) as magnitude. The University of Michigan's preliminary March measure saw sentiment fall sharply and in percentage terms, dropped the most since mid-2022. The US threat to impose 25% tariff on all imports of any country that imports Venezuelan oil or gas. In addition to the US, China India and a few Latam countries are noted buyers of Venezuelan oil and gas. The US imported 25.4 mln barrels of oil from Venezuela in Q4 25, almost a 73% increase from Q4 24. US policy is often (mis-)characterized as "isolationist," but this underscores its unilateral thrust.?

EURO:? The euro was sold to a two-week low in North America yesterday near $1.0780 and made a marginal new low today. A convincing break could target $1.0700-25. The persistent dollar selling from Europe seen earlier this month, ostensibly as its record purchases of US equities last year was unwound, has eased in recent sessions. It appears to be a better two-way market in Europe. Speculators in the futures market were net long euros for the second consecutive week (in the CFTC reporting week ending March 18). They had been net short from the middle of last October. The net long position of 59.4k contracts is the most since mid-September 2024. It is a light week for eurozone data, but Germany's IFO reported a small improvement sentiment among the 9000 companies it surveyed, which echoes the improvement seen in other surveys, including yesterday's preliminary PMI. It was the third consecutive monthly increase and at 86.7, the assessment of the overall business climate is the best since last July.?

CNY: ?The dollar rose to a two-week high against the offshore yuan (~CNH7.2680) yesterday and is consolidating today. If sustained, it would be the sixth consecutive daily advance. This matches the longest advance since October 2022. It has approached the next key chart area is around today seen near CNH7.2725. The PBOC set the dollar's reference rate at CNY7.1788 (CNY7.1780 yesterday). It is the fourth consecutive session that fix has been raised and its highest level in a couple of months. This gives the dollar more a little more scope to appreciate. One cannot help but suspect the PBOC is signaling a change. Also, coming out of its first meeting of the year, the PBOC renewed its commitment to cut rates and reserve requirements but does not seem to be in a hurry to do so.

JPY:? Firmer US Treasury yields and a slightly wider US 10-year premium over Japan helped lift keep the dollar bid against the yen yesterday and settled above JPY150 for the first time this month. The gains were extended those gains today to about JPY150.95, its best level since March 3. It stalled but held above JPY150.40 on the pullback. Provided the JPY150 area holds, the next technical target is the month's high near JPY151.30. The five-day moving average crossed above the 20-day moving average in the middle of last week, for the first time since mid-January. Expectations for the BOJ have not changed much despite the softer real sector data. The market may be more sensitive to the March Tokyo CPI at the end of the week. The headline is expected to soften for the second consecutive month. The core measures look flat.

GBP:? ?Sterling traded on both sides of last Friday's range yesterday by a couple hundredths of a cent and settled little changed and within pre-weekend range. Still, it was rebuffed last week after poking above $1.30 and looks to be rolling over. It is consolidating quietly today in less than a third-of-a-cent range today above $1.29. The next support area is seen in the $1.2840-$1.2860 area. Tomorrow is an important day for the UK, rates, and sterling. February CPI is due and is expected to jump 0.5%. However, given the base effect, the year-over-year rate may be steady at 3.0%, while the core and services inflation may slow slightly. The focus is also on fiscal policy. The Office for Budget Responsibility will update its forecasts. It will likely recognize that the economy is weaker than it previously projected. This translates into a larger budget deficit and requires a response from Chancellor Reeves. The Labour government seems more inclined to cut welfare than boost taxes or embrace a larger shortfall.

CAD:? ?The US dollar was sold to a three-day low yesterday, slightly below CAD1.4300. Last week's low was near CAD1.4270 and that is roughly where the lower end of the triangle pattern is seen. This month's low was closer to CAD1.4240. The greenback is in a narrow range today (~CAD1.4310-CAD1.4335). Carney is taking the Liberal Party in a more pro-business direction. To outflank his call to reduce the lowest income bracket by one percentage point to 14%, the Conservative leader Poilievre has promised a 2.35 percentage point cut. Both candidates are advocating more defense and infrastructure spending. Both candidates will likely generate a larger budget deficit, but this is not as pressing an issue as it may be in some other G10 countries. Last year's fiscal shortfall was 2% of GDP and was anticipated to fall to around 1.3% this year. Tensions with the US and housing and health care affordability seem more salient.

AUD: ?While sterling had an outside day, the Australian dollar recorded an inside day yesterday as it was confined to the pre-weekend range. It is trading inside yesterday's range so far today (~$0.6280-$0.6295). It had been turned back from $0.6400 last week and encountered selling pressure in the past two sessions a little above $0.6300. A break of the $0.6260 area could see a return to the month's low, slightly below $0.6200. The first thing tomorrow, Australia reports February CPI. It looks flat at 2.5% year-over-year. It is possible that the trimmed mean measure ticks down. Regardless of the details, a cut next week (April 1) remains unlikely. The central bank puts more weight on the quarterly reading, and the Q1 report is due at the end of April. The futures market is discounting a little more than a 70% chance of a cut at the May 20 meeting, the last one in H1 25.?

MXN:? The Mexican peso was the strongest emerging market currency yesterday, gaining about 1%. This recouped 2/3 of last week loss, which was the largest weekly decline in two months. The peso edged a little higher today, but the greenback has held (barely) above MXN20.00. The peso's gains were impressive not only because of the US dollar's broader strength, but also in the context of (slightly) softer than expected CPI for the first half of March and the continued weakness in January's IGAE monthly indicator (similar to a monthly GDP). It has fallen for three of the past four months. The combination of the peso's resilience and the data makes a 50 bp rate cut later this week less debatable. Meanwhile, the dollar recorded the lows for Q1 25 last week near BRL5.6320. It brings a three day-advance into today. It settled slightly below BRL5.7650 yesterday to resurface above the 20-day moving average (~BRL5.7640) for the first time since March 13. Nearby resistance extended from BRL5.7750 to BRL5.8100.

More By This Author:

The Possibility That The US Is Toning Down Its April 2 Tariff Threat Helps Lift Equities Week Ahead: Is The Dollar Bottoming?March Madness? The Dollar Is Closing In On Its Best Week This Month

headline: FX Market Calm On The Surface, Angst Below
News:
FX Market Calm On The Surface, Angst BelowMar 25, 2025

Image Source:?Pexels ?

Overview:? ?The US dollar is consolidating its recent gains against the G10 currencies in quiet and relatively uneventful turnover. There continue to be mixed signals about the US tariffs threatened for next week. President Trump himself said that auto tariffs were coming soon as in days, while suggesting that there may be "a lot" of carve-outs from the reciprocal tariffs. EU's trade representative Sefcovic is meeting with US Commerce Secretary Lutnick today and a US delegation is in India today to talk trade. The greenback mixed against emerging market currencies. The Mexican peso was the strongest yesterday, gaining 1% against the greenback and is marginally stronger today. Of note, the offshore yuan is lower for the sixth consecutive session, its longest losing streak in about 2 1/2 years and the PBOC set the dollar's reference rate higher for the fourth consecutive session. It seems to be signaling an acceptance of a weaker yuan, perhaps given the tariff threats, which were extended yesterday to include buying Venezuelan oil and gas.?

While most of the bourses in the Asia Pacific region rose, including Indonesia, where the weakness of the rupiah spurred central bank intervention today, the Hang Seng and mainland shares that trade there, tumbled more than 2%. The Stoxx 600 in Europe is trying to snap a three-day decline, while US index futures are paring yesterday's strong gains. Benchmark 10-year rates are 2-5 bp higher in Europe, while the 10-year US Treasury yield is edging higher for the third consecutive session. If sustained, it would be the longest advance this month and at 4.35%, it is the highest level since late February. Gold is firm, holding above $3000, but below yesterday's high ($3033). May WTI is extending yesterday's 1.2% advance at near $69.50 is at its best level since March 3 as it extends the rally into the fifth consecutive session.?

USD: ?The Dollar Index held last Friday's low in the yesterday's pullback and was better bid in North America. After falling from a peak near 110.20 on January 13, DXY has carved out a bottom this month near 103.20. It reached almost 104.45 yesterday and posted its highest close since March 3. It is trading firmly but quietly today between about 104.25-and 104.45. The 104.90-105.00 area still looks like a reasonable target in the coming days. Today's high frequency data includes house prices, new home sales, and the Philadelphia's Fed's non-manufacturing survey. Recall that the Philly Fed's business outlook reported last week pulled back to 12.5 from 18.1, its lowest reading in Q1. The optimism of January (44.30) has faded. The Conference Board's measure of consumer for March will be reported, but the question is not so much the direction (down) as magnitude. The University of Michigan's preliminary March measure saw sentiment fall sharply and in percentage terms, dropped the most since mid-2022. The US threat to impose 25% tariff on all imports of any country that imports Venezuelan oil or gas. In addition to the US, China India and a few Latam countries are noted buyers of Venezuelan oil and gas. The US imported 25.4 mln barrels of oil from Venezuela in Q4 25, almost a 73% increase from Q4 24. US policy is often (mis-)characterized as "isolationist," but this underscores its unilateral thrust.?

EURO:? The euro was sold to a two-week low in North America yesterday near $1.0780 and made a marginal new low today. A convincing break could target $1.0700-25. The persistent dollar selling from Europe seen earlier this month, ostensibly as its record purchases of US equities last year was unwound, has eased in recent sessions. It appears to be a better two-way market in Europe. Speculators in the futures market were net long euros for the second consecutive week (in the CFTC reporting week ending March 18). They had been net short from the middle of last October. The net long position of 59.4k contracts is the most since mid-September 2024. It is a light week for eurozone data, but Germany's IFO reported a small improvement sentiment among the 9000 companies it surveyed, which echoes the improvement seen in other surveys, including yesterday's preliminary PMI. It was the third consecutive monthly increase and at 86.7, the assessment of the overall business climate is the best since last July.?

CNY: ?The dollar rose to a two-week high against the offshore yuan (~CNH7.2680) yesterday and is consolidating today. If sustained, it would be the sixth consecutive daily advance. This matches the longest advance since October 2022. It has approached the next key chart area is around today seen near CNH7.2725. The PBOC set the dollar's reference rate at CNY7.1788 (CNY7.1780 yesterday). It is the fourth consecutive session that fix has been raised and its highest level in a couple of months. This gives the dollar more a little more scope to appreciate. One cannot help but suspect the PBOC is signaling a change. Also, coming out of its first meeting of the year, the PBOC renewed its commitment to cut rates and reserve requirements but does not seem to be in a hurry to do so.

JPY:? Firmer US Treasury yields and a slightly wider US 10-year premium over Japan helped lift keep the dollar bid against the yen yesterday and settled above JPY150 for the first time this month. The gains were extended those gains today to about JPY150.95, its best level since March 3. It stalled but held above JPY150.40 on the pullback. Provided the JPY150 area holds, the next technical target is the month's high near JPY151.30. The five-day moving average crossed above the 20-day moving average in the middle of last week, for the first time since mid-January. Expectations for the BOJ have not changed much despite the softer real sector data. The market may be more sensitive to the March Tokyo CPI at the end of the week. The headline is expected to soften for the second consecutive month. The core measures look flat.

GBP:? ?Sterling traded on both sides of last Friday's range yesterday by a couple hundredths of a cent and settled little changed and within pre-weekend range. Still, it was rebuffed last week after poking above $1.30 and looks to be rolling over. It is consolidating quietly today in less than a third-of-a-cent range today above $1.29. The next support area is seen in the $1.2840-$1.2860 area. Tomorrow is an important day for the UK, rates, and sterling. February CPI is due and is expected to jump 0.5%. However, given the base effect, the year-over-year rate may be steady at 3.0%, while the core and services inflation may slow slightly. The focus is also on fiscal policy. The Office for Budget Responsibility will update its forecasts. It will likely recognize that the economy is weaker than it previously projected. This translates into a larger budget deficit and requires a response from Chancellor Reeves. The Labour government seems more inclined to cut welfare than boost taxes or embrace a larger shortfall.

CAD:? ?The US dollar was sold to a three-day low yesterday, slightly below CAD1.4300. Last week's low was near CAD1.4270 and that is roughly where the lower end of the triangle pattern is seen. This month's low was closer to CAD1.4240. The greenback is in a narrow range today (~CAD1.4310-CAD1.4335). Carney is taking the Liberal Party in a more pro-business direction. To outflank his call to reduce the lowest income bracket by one percentage point to 14%, the Conservative leader Poilievre has promised a 2.35 percentage point cut. Both candidates are advocating more defense and infrastructure spending. Both candidates will likely generate a larger budget deficit, but this is not as pressing an issue as it may be in some other G10 countries. Last year's fiscal shortfall was 2% of GDP and was anticipated to fall to around 1.3% this year. Tensions with the US and housing and health care affordability seem more salient.

AUD: ?While sterling had an outside day, the Australian dollar recorded an inside day yesterday as it was confined to the pre-weekend range. It is trading inside yesterday's range so far today (~$0.6280-$0.6295). It had been turned back from $0.6400 last week and encountered selling pressure in the past two sessions a little above $0.6300. A break of the $0.6260 area could see a return to the month's low, slightly below $0.6200. The first thing tomorrow, Australia reports February CPI. It looks flat at 2.5% year-over-year. It is possible that the trimmed mean measure ticks down. Regardless of the details, a cut next week (April 1) remains unlikely. The central bank puts more weight on the quarterly reading, and the Q1 report is due at the end of April. The futures market is discounting a little more than a 70% chance of a cut at the May 20 meeting, the last one in H1 25.?

MXN:? The Mexican peso was the strongest emerging market currency yesterday, gaining about 1%. This recouped 2/3 of last week loss, which was the largest weekly decline in two months. The peso edged a little higher today, but the greenback has held (barely) above MXN20.00. The peso's gains were impressive not only because of the US dollar's broader strength, but also in the context of (slightly) softer than expected CPI for the first half of March and the continued weakness in January's IGAE monthly indicator (similar to a monthly GDP). It has fallen for three of the past four months. The combination of the peso's resilience and the data makes a 50 bp rate cut later this week less debatable. Meanwhile, the dollar recorded the lows for Q1 25 last week near BRL5.6320. It brings a three day-advance into today. It settled slightly below BRL5.7650 yesterday to resurface above the 20-day moving average (~BRL5.7640) for the first time since March 13. Nearby resistance extended from BRL5.7750 to BRL5.8100.

headline: Рубль растет на МОЕХ перед налогами и слабеет на FX после переговоров США-РФ
News:
МОСКВА, 25 мар (Рейтер) - Рубль во вторник показывал
смешанную динамику при текущем приглушенном геополитическом
новостном фоне, немного снизившем оптимизм в отношении
российской валюты на внешних рынках, но одновременно при
поддержке на локальном рынке фактора предстоящих налоговых
выплат, к которым сырьевые компании продают экспортную выручку.
    Котировки пары юань/рубль расчетами "завтра" к 17.45 МСК
были на Мосбирже вблизи отметки 11,52, российская валюта
набирает 0,7%.
    Беспоставочные однодневные фьючерсные контракты на пары
юань/рубль, доллар/рубль, евро/рубль на Мосбирже к этому времени
котировались вблизи отметок 11,55, 85,50 и 92,20 соответственно,
и рубль набирает 0,5% к юаню, 0,7% к доллару и 0,6% к евро.
    Пара доллар/рубль <RUB=> к 17.45 МСК котировалась на форексе
по 84,57, и рубль теряет 0,8%. На внебиржевом российском
валютном рынке пара доллар/рубль к этому времени котировалась в
диапазоне 84,00-84,50, согласно усредненным данным российских
поставщиков финансовых услуг.
    Пара евро/рубль <EURRUB=> находится сейчас на форексе вблизи
отметки 91,48, и здесь рубль теряет 1%. На российском же
межбанке евро котируется в диапазоне 90,35-91,90 рубля.
    "Техническая картина по рублю остается сильной и устойчивого
разворота (рублевого) курса доллара вверх пока не
прослеживается", - отмечает Александр Потавин из ФГ Финам.
    Сегодня давление на внешние котировки рубля могло оказать
отсутствие официальных итогов вчерашних переговоров США и РФ,
тогда как поддержкой на локальном рынке выступают ожидания
допродаж экспортной выручки под предстоящие в пятницу расчеты с
бюджетом.
    Пресс-секретарь российского президента Дмитрий Песков
сегодня сообщил, что итоги российско-американских переговоров в
Эр-Рияде сейчас анализируются обеими сторонами, но раскрываться
их содержание не будет. Также, по словам Пескова, разговор на
высшем уровне между президентом РФ Владимиром Путиным и
президентом США Дональдом Трампом пока не запланирован, но при
необходимости он может быть оперативно организован.
    "Геополитический фон пока не располагает к выраженному
укреплению российской валюты. В отсутствие негативных
геополитических новостей курс к концу недели все же способен
уйти к 11,30 рубля за юань на фоне налогового периода", -
полагают аналитики банка Санкт-Петербург.
    В ближайшую пятницу будет проходить Единый налоговый платеж,
при этом в текущем месяце сырьевые корпорации проводят
окончательные расчеты с бюджетом за прошлый год, в том числе
уплачивают налог на дополнительный доход за четвертый квартал
почти на полтриллиона рублей, что еще может поддержать курс
российской валюты в ближайшие дни, однако продажи экспортной
выручки под расчеты с бюджетом достаточно дискретны и
малопредсказуемы.
    На внешнем контуре поддержкой рублю выступает рынок нефти,
где базовые сорта котируются вблизи свежих трехнедельных
максимумов. Североморская смесь Brent <LCOc1> сегодня достигла
отметки 73,57 впервые с 3 марта, сейчас она дорожает на 0,4% и
оценивается в $73,28 за баррель после роста накануне более чем
на 1% на фоне решения Дональда Трампа ввести 25-процентные
пошлины при торговле с США для стран, импортирующих нефть и газ
из Венесуэлы.
    По мнению Александра Потавина из Финама, безотносительно
геополитики и динамики нефти апрель обычно является одним из
наиболее благоприятных для рубля месяцем в году согласно
статистике прошлых лет, в том числе и с учетом сезонно низкого
спроса на иностранную валюту. 
    По его мнению, американская валюта в следующем месяце будет
торговаться в диапазоне 82,00-88,00 рубля, а китайская валюта -
в пределах отметок 11,30-12,00 рубля за юань.

 (Московское бюро)
 ((moscow.newsroom@thomsonreuters.com))

headline: BUZZ-FX options wrap-Neutral EUR, huge 1.0800, GBP risk, AUD value
News:
March 25 (Reuters) - G10 FX Option implied volatility maintains its
drift lower across all expiry dates amid a lack of realised volatility or
near-term directional catalysts. While there is potential value when compared to
past realised volatility measures in some currency pairs and expiry dates, there
has been no rush to initiate new long positions.
    Benchmark 1-month expiry EUR/USD implied volatility extends its setback from
mid-March highs at 9.25 to 7.4. Interestingly, the 1-month 25 delta risk
reversals have since reverted to a neutral bias, having fallen from new multi-
year highs for topside strikes on March 10-11, to 0.25 for downside strikes last
week. Huge 1.0750 and 1.0800 strikes expire on Thursday and Friday, with related
hedging flows providing a potential draw if FX remains nearby. 
    USD/JPY 1-month implied volatility has now almost fully retraced its
February 1 to March 11 rally from 9.25 to 12.4. One-month risk reversals have
seen their JPY call over put implied volatility premium revert to 1.2 from 1.85.
    Overnight expiry GBP related implied volatility opened higher on Tuesday as
its expiry now includes a wealth of UK inflation data and the eagerly awaited
Spring statement from the UK Government Chancellor. Those gains were not
significant but stand out against a low volatility back-drop and should warn
against complacency.
    AUD/USD 1-month expiry matches recent setback lows at 9.25 and is one of
those contracts that might offer value when compared with its past realised
volatility measures.  
    
          
    
        For more click on [FXBUZ]

    <^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

editing by Ed Osmond)

headline: BUZZ-A shift in EUR/USD options directional risk premium
News:
* Options thrive on volatility and gauge it with implied volatility 
    * Risk reversals ask implied volatility premium for most vulnerable
direction
    * One-month expiry is the benchmark and its moved a lot in EUR/USD of late 
    * From long standing downside strike premium, it flipped to topside March
4-5
    * Came amid spot break higher from 1.05-1.08, which fuelled option buying
    * It reverted to a small downside strike premium as spot slipped last week 
    * 1-month 25 delta risk reversals now flat (neutral directional premium)
    * Option implied volatility is low/heavy - consistent with spot
consolidation
    * Beware draw from huge 1.0800 strike expiries if all else fails to excite

headline: FX Market Calm on the Surface, Angst Below
News:
FX Market Calm on the Surface, Angst BelowMar 25, 2025

Overview:?The US dollar is consolidating its recent gains against the G10 currencies in quiet and relatively uneventful turnover. There continue to be mixed signals about the US tariffs threatened for next week. President Trump himself said that auto tariffs were coming soon as in days, while suggesting that there may be "a lot" of carve-outs from the reciprocal tariffs. EU's trade representative Sefcovic is meeting with US Commerce Secretary Lutnick today and a US delegation is in India today to talk trade. The greenback mixed against emerging market currencies. The Mexican peso was the strongest yesterday, gaining 1% against the greenback and is marginally stronger today. Of note, the offshore yuan is lower for the sixth consecutive session, its longest losing streak in about 2 1/2 years and the PBOC set the dollar's reference rate higher for the fourth consecutive session. It seems to be signaling an acceptance of a weaker yuan, perhaps given the tariff threats, which were extended yesterday to include buying Venezuelan oil and gas.?

While most of the bourses in the Asia Pacific region rose, including Indonesia, where the weakness of the rupiah spurred central bank intervention today, the Hang Seng and mainland shares that trade there, tumbled more than 2%. The Stoxx 600 in Europe is trying to snap a three-day decline, while US index futures are paring yesterday's strong gains. Benchmark 10-year rates are 2-5 bp higher in Europe, while the 10-year US Treasury yield is edging higher for the third consecutive session. If sustained, it would be the longest advance this month and at 4.35%, it is the highest level since late February. Gold is firm, holding above $3000, but below yesterday's high ($3033). May WTI is extending yesterday's 1.2% advance at near $69.50 is at its best level since March 3 as it extends the rally into the fifth consecutive session.?

USD:The Dollar Index held last Friday's low in the yesterday's pullback and was better bid in North America. After falling from a peak near 110.20 on January 13, DXY has carved out a bottom this month near 103.20. It reached almost 104.45 yesterday and posted its highest close since March 3. It is trading firmly but quietly today between about 104.25-and 104.45. The 104.90-105.00 area still looks like a reasonable target in the coming days. Today's high frequency data includes house prices, new home sales, and the Philadelphia's Fed's non-manufacturing survey. Recall that the Philly Fed's business outlook reported last week pulled back to 12.5 from 18.1, its lowest reading in Q1. The optimism of January (44.30) has faded. The Conference Board's measure of consumer for March will be reported, but the question is not so much the direction (down) as magnitude. The University of Michigan's preliminary March measure saw sentiment fall sharply and in percentage terms, dropped the most since mid-2022. The US threat to impose 25% tariff on all imports of any country that imports Venezuelan oil or gas. In addition to the US, China India and a few Latam countries are noted buyers of Venezuelan oil and gas. The US imported 25.4 mln barrels of oil from Venezuela in Q4 25, almost a 73% increase from Q4 24. US policy is often (mis-)characterized as "isolationist," but this underscores its unilateral thrust.?

EURO:The euro was sold to a two-week low in North America yesterday near $1.0780 and made a marginal new low today. A convincing break could target $1.0700-25. The persistent dollar selling from Europe seen earlier this month, ostensibly as its record purchases of US equities last year was unwound, has eased in recent sessions. It appears to be a better two-way market in Europe. Speculators in the futures market were net long euros for the second consecutive week (in the CFTC reporting week ending March 18). They had been net short from the middle of last October. The net long position of 59.4k contracts is the most since mid-September 2024. It is a light week for eurozone data, but Germany's IFO reported a small improvement sentiment among the 9000 companies it surveyed, which echoes the improvement seen in other surveys, including yesterday's preliminary PMI. It was the third consecutive monthly increase and at 86.7, the assessment of the overall business climate is the best since last July.?

CNY:The dollar rose to a two-week high against the offshore yuan (~CNH7.2680) yesterday and is consolidating today. If sustained, it would be the sixth consecutive daily advance. This matches the longest advance since October 2022. It has approached the next key chart area is around today seen near CNH7.2725. The PBOC set the dollar's reference rate at CNY7.1788 (CNY7.1780 yesterday). It is the fourth consecutive session that fix has been raised and its highest level in a couple of months. This gives the dollar more a little more scope to appreciate. One cannot help but suspect the PBOC is signaling a change. Also, coming out of its first meeting of the year, the PBOC renewed its commitment to cut rates and reserve requirements but does not seem to be in a hurry to do so.

JPY:Firmer US Treasury yields and a slightly wider US 10-year premium over Japan helped lift keep the dollar bid against the yen yesterday and settled above JPY150 for the first time this month. The gains were extended those gains today to about JPY150.95, its best level since March 3. It stalled but held above JPY150.40 on the pullback. Provided the JPY150 area holds, the next technical target is the month's high near JPY151.30. The five-day moving average crossed above the 20-day moving average in the middle of last week, for the first time since mid-January. Expectations for the BOJ have not changed much despite the softer real sector data. The market may be more sensitive to the March Tokyo CPI at the end of the week. The headline is expected to soften for the second consecutive month. The core measures look flat.

GBP:?Sterling traded on both sides of last Friday's range yesterday by a couple hundredths of a cent and settled little changed and within pre-weekend range. Still, it was rebuffed last week after poking above $1.30 and looks to be rolling over. It is consolidating quietly today in less than a third-of-a-cent range today above $1.29. The next support area is seen in the $1.2840-$1.2860 area. Tomorrow is an important day for the UK, rates, and sterling. February CPI is due and is expected to jump 0.5%. However, given the base effect, the year-over-year rate may be steady at 3.0%, while the core and services inflation may slow slightly. The focus is also on fiscal policy. The Office for Budget Responsibility will update its forecasts. It will likely recognize that the economy is weaker than it previously projected. This translates into a larger budget deficit and requires a response from Chancellor Reeves. The Labour government seems more inclined to cut welfare than boost taxes or embrace a larger shortfall.

CAD:?The US dollar was sold to a three-day low yesterday, slightly below CAD1.4300. Last week's low was near CAD1.4270 and that is roughly where the lower end of the triangle pattern is seen. This month's low was closer to CAD1.4240. The greenback is in a narrow range today (~CAD1.4310-CAD1.4335). Carney is taking the Liberal Party in a more pro-business direction. To outflank his call to reduce the lowest income bracket by one percentage point to 14%, the Conservative leader Poilievre has promised a 2.35 percentage point cut. Both candidates are advocating more defense and infrastructure spending. Both candidates will likely generate a larger budget deficit, but this is not as pressing an issue as it may be in some other G10 countries. Last year's fiscal shortfall was 2% of GDP and was anticipated to fall to around 1.3% this year. Tensions with the US and housing and health care affordability seem more salient.

AUD:While sterling had an outside day, the Australian dollar recorded an inside day yesterday as it was confined to the pre-weekend range. It is trading inside yesterday's range so far today (~$0.6280-$0.6295). It had been turned back from $0.6400 last week and encountered selling pressure in the past two sessions a little above $0.6300. A break of the $0.6260 area could see a return to the month's low, slightly below $0.6200. The first thing tomorrow, Australia reports February CPI. It looks flat at 2.5% year-over-year. It is possible that the trimmed mean measure ticks down. Regardless of the details, a cut next week (April 1) remains unlikely. The central bank puts more weight on the quarterly reading, and the Q1 report is due at the end of April. The futures market is discounting a little more than a 70% chance of a cut at the May 20 meeting, the last one in H1 25.?

MXN:The Mexican peso was the strongest emerging market currency yesterday, gaining about 1%. This recouped 2/3 of last week loss, which was the largest weekly decline in two months. The peso edged a little higher today, but the greenback has held (barely) above MXN20.00. The peso's gains were impressive not only because of the US dollar's broader strength, but also in the context of (slightly) softer than expected CPI for the first half of March and the continued weakness in January's IGAE monthly indicator (similar to a monthly GDP). It has fallen for three of the past four months. The combination of the peso's resilience and the data makes a 50 bp rate cut later this week less debatable. Meanwhile, the dollar recorded the lows for Q1 25 last week near BRL5.6320. It brings a three day-advance into today. It settled slightly below BRL5.7650 yesterday to resurface above the 20-day moving average (~BRL5.7640) for the first time since March 13. Nearby resistance extended from BRL5.7750 to BRL5.8100.

headline: Рубль показывает смешанную динамику в ожидании новых вводных и крупных потоков
News:
МОСКВА, 25 мар (Рейтер) - Рубль показывает смешанную
динамику в узких диапазонах, ожидая новых вводных во
внешнеполитической повестке и крупных реальных объемов на
покупку-продажу инвалюты.
    Котировки пары юань/рубль расчетами "завтра" к 11.40 МСК
были на Мосбирже вблизи отметки 11,57, российская валюта
набирает 0,3%.
    Беспоставочные однодневные фьючерсные контракты на пары
юань/рубль, доллар/рубль, евро/рубль на Мосбирже к этому времени
котировались вблизи отметок 11,58, 86,10 и 92,50 соответственно,
и рубль набирает 0,2% к юаню, почти не меняется к доллару и
дорожает на 0,3% к евро.
    Пара доллар/рубль <RUB=> к 11.40 МСК котировалась на форексе
по 84,50, и рубль теряет три четверти процента. На внебиржевом
российском валютном рынке пара доллар/рубль к этому времени
котировалась в диапазоне 84,00-84,60, согласно усредненным
данным российских поставщиков финансовых услуг.
    Пара евро/рубль <EURRUB=> находится сейчас на форексе вблизи
отметки 91,14, и здесь рубль теряет 0,6%. На российском же
межбанке евро котируется в диапазоне 90,10-91,70 рубля.
    Рубль остается недалеко от своих многомесячных максимумов -
неделю назад он отметился на уровнях 81,00 за доллар и 88,88 за
евро на форексе, а также 11,13 за юань на Мосбирже впервые с
июня прошлого года.
    Основной внеэкономической поддержкой рублю в текущем году
выступают надежды на скорое завершение украинского конфликта, а
также ожидания улучшения отношений между Москвой и Вашингтоном с
последующей возможностью ослабления американских санкций против
России при республиканской администрации США.
    Представители России и США провели в понедельник в Эр-Рияде
очередные переговоры, которые были сосредоточены на предложении
о прекращении огня в Черном море - части дипломатических усилий,
которые, как надеется Вашингтон, помогут проложить путь к
переговорам о более широком мире.
    При этом переговоры России и США будут продолжены, и в них
будут вовлечены Организация Объединенных Наций и другие страны,
сообщил ТАСС со ссылкой на главу комитета Совета Федерации по
международным делам, одного из участников российской делегации
Григория Карасина.
    Помимо геополитики, динамику курса рубля определяют реальные
денежные потоки, в частности, продажа экспортной выручки под
предстоящую уплату налогов и спрос импортеров на значительно
подешевевшую за последнее время иностранную валюту, рублевые
котировки которой остаются вблизи многомесячных минимумов.
    В ближайшую пятницу будет проходить Единый налоговый платеж,
при этом в текущем месяце сырьевые корпорации проводят
окончательные расчеты с бюджетом за прошлый год, в том числе
уплачивают налог на дополнительный доход за четвертый квартал
почти на полтриллиона рублей, что еще может поддержать курс
российской валюты в ближайшие дни, однако продажи экспортной
выручки под расчеты с бюджетом достаточно дискретны и
малопредсказуемы.
    "Геополитический фон пока не располагает к выраженному
укреплению российской валюты. В отсутствии негативных
геополитических новостей курс к концу недели все же способен
уйти к 11,30 рубля за юань на фоне налогового периода", -
полагают аналитики банка Санкт-Петербург.
    На внешнем контуре поддержкой рублю выступает рынок нефти,
где базовые сорта котируются вблизи свежих трехнедельных
максимумов. Североморская смесь Brent <LCOc1> дорожает на 0,4% и
оценивается в $73,30 за баррель после роста накануне более чем
на 1% на фоне решения Дональда Трампа ввести 25-процентные
пошлины при торговле с США для стран, импортирующих нефть и газ
из Венесуэлы.
    

 (Московское бюро)
 ((moscow.newsroom@thomsonreuters.com))

headline: 更新版 1-中国汇市：美指偏强人民币收跌创半个月新低，对等关税阴影下料延续偏弱走势
News:
* 
      人民币收跌创半个月新低，中间价刷新逾两月低点
    

        * 
      中间价实际值与路透预测偏离扩至近850点
    

        * 
      美元延续反弹，4月对等关税忧虑扰动风险情绪
    

        * 
      人民币承压下跌，短期料维持偏弱走势
    

  
 (新增评论及收盘报价)
       路透上海/北京3月25日 - 人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周二收跌120点创半个月新
低，中间价则四连跌刷新逾两个月新低，较路透预测偏离扩至近850点。交易员称，美元延
续反弹态势，而4月初美国对等关税政策落地也扰动市场情绪，人民币继续小幅调整态势，
预计短期维持偏弱走势。
    
    一中资行交易员表示，除了美指持续反弹外，市场开始忧心美国对等关税实施后对贸易
的影响，人民币承压走弱。    
       
    “短期美元/人民币就是跟着美元走，目前看美元还是有些反弹的空间，”一中资行交
易员称，“中间价也有一点点动，人民币慢慢贬。”      
    
    
    美国总统特朗普最新表示，很可能在4月2日实施对等征税时排除一系列针对特定行业的
关税，但特朗普政府的一位官员周一警告说，情况仍可能变化，尚未做出最终决定。华尔街
认为，此举表明他在这个数周以来搅动市场的问题上表现出了灵活性。  
      
    巴克莱银行最新报告称，美国加征关税举措对中国而言是“一颗难以咽下的药丸”；虽
然人工智能技术的发展有望提振中国经济增长，但不太可能抵消关税对经济的冲击。
    
    “我们仍然认为，鉴于出口商利润下滑以及贸易转移空间优先，人民币需要再次走弱一
对冲关税的不利影响，”报告称。
    
    花旗最新观点指出，美债收益率回升是人民币承压的关键，另外日圆走弱至150关口下
方，也会拖累离岸CNH；另外期权角度看，在4月2日美国新一轮关税宣布前，市场对人民币
看跌的押注持续增长。
    
    招商银行金融市场部认为，近期美元反弹有经济数据、欧洲利好兑现，关税临近等因素
，在下周关税落地之前，还是需要警惕美元继续反弹。“但关税是不是再被豁免和延期也存
在变数，这会限制反弹的幅度。”       

    今年大部分时间里，美元一直承受着压力，市场对特朗普将迅速出台有利于增长的政策
的假设转变成了对贸易关税实施和最终影响的担忧。美国商品期货交易委员会(CFTC)上周五
公布的数据显示，投机客上周对美元转为净看跌，为10月以来首次。
    
    
    全球汇市方面，美元兑日圆汇率周二早盘触及三周高点，美元全线走坚，受强劲的美国
服务业数据和关税方面的谨慎乐观情绪支撑。[FRX/CN]
    
    以下为今日在岸市场人民币兑美元<CNY=CFXS>收盘价、中间价<CNY=PBOC>，以及离岸市
场人民币的主要报价：

headline: 中国汇市：人民币收跌下探半个月低点，因美指走强及对等关税忧虑扰动情绪
News:
路透北京3月25日 - 人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周二收盘跌120点至7.264元，创3月10日以来新低，因美元延续反弹态势，而4月初美国对等关税政策落地也在扰动市场情绪。

    一中资行交易员表示，除了美指持续反弹外，市场开始忧心美国对等关税实施后对贸易的影响，人民币承压走弱。

    离岸CNH<CNH=D3>最新报7.2699元，上日收报7.2627元，目前两地价差为65点。

    全球汇市方面，美元兑日圆汇率周二早盘触及三周高点，美元全线走坚，受强劲的美国服务业数据和关税方面的谨慎乐观情绪支撑。[FRX/CN]（完）

rong.ma.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))

headline: Asia-Pacific markets mostly advance mirroring Wall Street gains amid tariff optimism
News:
Asia-Pacific markets mostly advance mirroring Wall Street gains amid tariff optimismAsia-Pacific markets mostly higher on Tuesday mirrored an upbeat session on Wall Street overnight amid optimism that the Trump administration may adopt a more targeted approach to tariffs, easing tariff concerns.

Meanwhile, investors await clarity on Trump's reciprocal tariffs next week, with uncertainty over the size of the duties and targeted countries.

Japan (NKY:IND) rose 0.45% above 38,000, while the broader Topix Index climbed 0.7% to 2,810 on Tuesday, with the latter approaching an eight-month-high. The Japanese yen remained weak at around 150.7 per dollar on Tuesday, hovering near a three-week low.

Domestically, minutes from the Bank of Japan's January meeting showed that policymakers remain open to additional interest rate hikes, depending on wage growth and inflation trends. One member suggested the policy rate could reach 1% in the second half of fiscal 2025.

China (SHCOMP) rose 0.04% to 3,367, while the Shenzhen Component fell 0.6% to 10,635 on Tuesday, and the offshore yuan extended its decline to around 7.27 per dollar, hovering near two-week lows, pressured by growing concerns over the effectiveness of China's stimulus measures in offsetting new US tariffs.

On the monetary policy front, the People's Bank of China is changing its monetary policy by prioritizing the seven-day reverse repo rate over the medium-term lending facility rate. This move, while intended to manage liquidity, introduces uncertainty about borrowing costs. The central bank plans to issue significant MLF loans and has hinted at potential future rate cuts, which is putting downward pressure on the yuan.

China's fiscal revenue declined by 1.6% from a year earlier in the first two months of 2025, reversing a 1.3% increase in 2024. Meanwhile, government spending rose 3.4%, slightly easing from a 3.6% rise last year.

China recently set a 5% GDP growth target and raised its deficit to a three-decade high while announcing plans to boost consumption and domestic demand.

Hong Kong (HSI) fell 1.99% to 23,417 on Tuesday morning, reversing gains from the prior session amid concerns over U.S. recession risks and China's deflation threat.

India (SENSEX) rose 0.73% to 78,630 in morning deals on Tuesday, rising for the seventh straight session and hitting their highest level since early January, mainly boosted by strong performances in the tech, financial services, and banking sectors.

Australia (AS51) rose 0.05% surpassing 7,980 to reach its highest level in over two weeks. The Australian dollar remained steady at $0.628 on Tuesday, remaining sideways so far this week, as investors awaited the government's general budget announcement.

Meanwhile, markets anticipate no changes in monetary policy when the Reserve Bank of Australia meets next week.

In the U.S., on Monday, all three major indexes ended higher driven by signs that U.S. trade sanctions may be less severe than feared, including President Trump's suggestion that some countries could receive exemptions.

U.S. stock futures drifted lower on Tuesday after Fed Bostic projected only one rate cut this year, citing rising inflation due to tariff concerns: Dow -0.20%; S&P 500 -0.22%; Nasdaq -0.23%.

Currencies: (JPY:USD), (CNY:USD), (AUD:USD), (INR:USD), (HKD:USD), (NZD:USD).

More on Asia:

headline: Юань просел до минимума 2нед на фоне укрепления доллара, несмотря на усилия ЦБ Китая
News:
ШАНХАЙ, 25 мар (Рейтер) - Юань опустился во вторник до
минимума двух недель по отношению к доллару - укрепление
"зеленого" и опасения о пошлинах в преддверии объявленного
президентом США Дональдом Трампом срока их вступления в силу
перевесили эффект от мер центрального банка Китая для поддержки
валюты.
    Спотовый юань в Китайской системе валютной торговли SFETS на
материковом рынке <CNY=CFXS> к 10:06 МСК был малоподвижен вблизи
отметки 7,2603?, ранее в ходе сессии опустившись до минимума с
10 марта в 7,2650 за доллар.
    На офшорном рынке ренминби <CNH=> также не показывал ярко
выраженной динамики, удерживаясь на уровне 7,2657. 
    Индекс доллара к корзине из шести основных валют <.DXY> 
вырос на 0,06% до 104,326?, достигнув во вторник пика трех
недель.
    Перед открытием сессии ЦБ Китая объявил срединный
фиксированный курс <CNY=PBOC> на уровне 7,1788 за доллар.
Значение оказалось на 842 pips (десятитысячных долей процентного
пункта) сильнее приведенного Рейтер прогноза аналитиков - самое
значительное расхождение за две недели, указывающее на попытки
центробанка усилить контроль над слабеющей валютой.
    "Валюта колебалась между ростом и снижением на фоне новостей
о торговле за последние 24 часа. При этом она не присоединилась
к ралли рисковых активов, последовавшему за появлением
информации о том, что Трамп намерен применять ответные тарифы
более избирательно", - говорится в записке аналитиков Citi.
    Трамп в понедельник сказал, что не все анонсированные
пошлины начнут действовать с 2 апреля, а некоторые страны могут
рассчитывать на отсрочку.
    
    
    Оригинал сообщения на английском языке доступен по коду:
[nL2N3Q802U]

 (Бюро Рейтер в Шанхае)

headline: 人民币衍生品：境内美元/人民币掉期曲线走平，跨季需求不减短端买需旺盛
News:
路透上海3月25日 - 季末临近使得中国银行间市场资金价格上行，机构对人民币的需求不减，而境内美元流动性均衡偏松，使得美元/人民币短端掉期<CNYTN=CFXS>回升明显，预计跨季之前短端掉期保持偏强；而美元走强推低离岸CNH<CNH=D3>，不过离岸人民币流动性<CNHTN=>暂并未收紧。
    
    交易员并表示，美债收益率反弹，而中国央行改变中期借贷便利（MLF）的招标方式，中国国债收益率下跌，中美负利差有所走扩，长端掉期<CNY1Y=CFXS>盘中回落至-2,050点附近，但套利买盘涌现，使得长端掉期收复部分跌幅，预计长端掉期仍将维持区间宽幅震荡。
    
    “短端掉期买盘很强，应该是机构缺人民币，长端的卖盘不少的，掉期曲线很平，”一中资行交易员称。
    
    
    
    另一外资行交易员表示，买长卖短操作仍有一定套利空间，跨季之前还是可以操作。
    
    中国央行周一意外提前预告3月中期借贷便利（MLF）放量续做，同时还改变了MLF招标方式，银行间债市周二早盘现券和期货一度明显走暖，10年国债收益率盘中亦跌破1.8%。
    
    分析人士称，招标方式的调整标志着MLF与政策利率彻底脱钩，MLF今后单纯作为结构性货币政策工具与市场利率接轨，成本有望下降，效果类似于结构性降息。
    
    澳新银行中国市场经济学家邢兆鹏指出，此次央行净投放加上人民币中间价走软，以及此前发布的央行货币政策例会，表明由于即将到来的关税冲击，政策基调将从鹰派转向中性。“如果（美国）加征关税，我们不能排除定向降准和降息的可能性。”
    
    美国总统特朗普最新表示，很可能在4月2日实施对等征税时排除一系列针对特定行业的关税，但特朗普政府的一位官员周一警告说，情况仍存变数，尚未做出最终决定。华尔街认为，此举表明他在这个数周以来搅动市场的问题上表现出了灵活性。
    
    
    市场人士认为，美国更具针对性的关税措施缓解了部分市场压力，但由于政策和经济方向仍不明朗，因此美国债市仍限于本月大部分时间的窄幅区间内。
    
    北京时间15:55，境内美元/人民币隔夜期掉期<CNYON=CFXA>报-4.65点，一周期掉期<CNYSW=CFXA>报-33点，一个月期<CNY1M=CFXA>报-153.5点，一年期<CNY1Y=CFXA>报-2,021点，上周五收盘四个期限掉期点分别收在-14.3点、-32.9点、-149点和-1,970点。
    
    根据利率平价模型，多数情况下美元/人民币掉期点与中美利差正相关，即当中美利差扩大时，美元/人民币掉期点相应上涨，反之亦然；其中一年期掉期走势是美元/人民币掉期市场的重要标杆。（完）

headline: 《汇市简讯》期权预示欧元/美元将进一步盘整，有下行倾向
News:
0743GMT - 
  
    * 外汇期权隐含波动率衡量实际波动率预期
    * 欧元/美元期权隐含波动率远低于 3 月初的高点，仍然承压
    * 指标一个月期隐含波动率为 7.6，创 2 月末以来新低，而 3 月 5 日的峰值为 9.2
    * 风险逆转期权对最脆弱方向的期权收取波动率溢价
    * 1 个月欧元/美元风险逆转3月初从看跌转为看涨
    * 此后，该合约重新出现小幅的看跌期权隐含波动率溢价
    * 价格走势显示期权预期汇率将进一步盘整，有下行倾向

headline: Рубль утром малоподвижен в ожидании новых вводных
News:
МОСКВА, 25 мар (Рейтер) - Рубль утром вторника
показывает минимальные изменения на форексе в ожидании новых
вводных во внешнеполитической повестке после вчерашних
переговоров США и РФ, по итогам которых ожидается позитивное
заявление, о чем Рейтер сообщил источник в Белом доме.
    Надежды на скорое завершение украинского конфликта, а также
ожидания улучшения отношений между Москвой и Вашингтоном с
последующей возможностью ослабления американских санкций против
России при республиканской администрации США выступают в текущем
году основной внеэкономической поддержкой рублю.
    На внутреннем валютном рынке после открытия торгов Мосбиржи
динамику курса рубля будут также определять реальные денежные
потоки, в частности, продажа экспортной выручки под пятничную
уплату налогов и спрос импортеров на значительно подешевевшую за
последнее время иностранную валюту, рублевые котировки которой
остаются вблизи многомесячных минимумов.
    Пара доллар/рубль <RUB=> к 9.30 МСК котировалась на форексе
по 83,90, рядом с уровнями закрытия понедельника, по итогам
которого рубль подорожал против доллара на 0,7%, согласно данным
LSEG.
    Пара евро/рубль <EURRUB=> котируется по 90,60, также близко
от последних значений понедельника, по итогам которого
российская валюта подорожала против европейской на 0,9%.
    Пара юань/рубль <CNYRUB=> сейчас находится на форексе у
отметки 12,19, что совпадает с последними вчерашними
показателями LSEG.
    Вчерашние же торги Мосбиржи парой юань/рубль расчетами
"завтра" завершились на уровне 11,60 рубля за юань - российская
валюта в итоге подешевела на 1,2% при объеме сделок в 114
миллиардов рублей.
    В котировках рубля на форексе вчера положительно отражались
ожидания улучшения геополитической ситуации, тогда как на
внутреннем рынке свою роль в его итоговом ослаблении сыграло
смещение баланса потоков в пользу покупателей иностранной
валюты, с лихвой переваривших все предложение экспортной
выручки.
    В ближайшую пятницу будет проходить Единый налоговый платеж,
при этом в текущем месяце сырьевые корпорации проводят
окончательные расчеты с бюджетом за прошлый год, в том числе
уплачивают налог на дополнительный доход за четвертый квартал
почти на полтриллиона рублей, что еще может поддержать курс
российской валюты в ближайшие дни, однако продажи экспортной
выручки под расчеты с бюджетом достаточно дискретны и
малопредсказуемы.
    На внешнем контуре поддержкой рублю выступает рынок нефти,
где базовые сорта котируются вблизи трехнедельных максимумов.
Североморская смесь Brent <LCOc1> показывает сейчас минимальные
изменения у отметки $73 за баррель после роста накануне более
чем на один процент на фоне решения Дональда Трампа ввести
25-процентные пошлины при торговле с США для стран,
импортирующих нефть и газ из Венесуэлы. 
    На форексе индекс доллара оценивается в 104,31 <=USD>, что
близко от последних вчерашних котировок. Пара евро/доллар также
находится вблизи уровней вчерашнего закрытия и котируется по
$1,08 <EUR=>.
    Китайский юань теряет 0,1% на континентальном рынке КНР
(7,2610) <CNY=> и немного меньше - на офшорном (7,2670) <CNH=>.
    

 (Московское бюро)
 ((moscow.newsroom@thomsonreuters.com))

headline: Yuan drops to two-week low despite PBOC's efforts as dollar firms
News:
SHANGHAI, March 25 (Reuters) - China's yuan fell to a
two-week low against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, as the central
bank's support efforts were overshadowed by the dollar's
strength and tariff concerns ahead of President Donald Trump's
looming deadline.
    Prior to the market opening, the People's Bank of China set
the midpoint rate <CNY=PBOC>, around which the yuan is allowed
to trade in a 2% band, at 7.1788 per dollar, 842 pips firmer
than a Reuters' estimate. This marked the largest gap in two
weeks, suggesting the central bank's attempts to tighten control
over the weakening currency.
    Still, the onshore yuan <CNY=CFXS> dropped to a low of
7.2650 per dollar, its weakest since March 10. 
    The offshore yuan <CNH=D3> fell for the sixth straight day,
reaching a low of 7.2703 per dollar, marking its longest losing
streak since October. 
    "The currency has been bounced between positive and negative
trade headlines in the past 24 hours. It missed the risk rally
which followed reports of Trump's reciprocal tariffs to be more
targeted," said analysts at Citi in a note.
    Trump said on Monday that not all of his threatened levies
would be imposed on April 2 and some countries may get breaks.
    The dollar index <.DXY> hit a three-week high on Tuesday
after some strong U.S. services data and cautious optimism on
the tariff front.
    Spot yuan <CNY=CFXS> opened at 7.2620 and was last trading
at 7.2637 as of 0247 GMT, 32 pips lower than the previous late
session close and 1.18% weaker than the midpoint.
    "USD longs building up as seen in USD/JPY's climb above 150
will also add upward pressure on the USD/CNH in near term. A
gauge of one-month call options over puts indicate bearish bets
on RMB (are) growing in the run up to the April 2 announcement,"
said Citi analysts. 
    Meanwhile, the PBOC said on Monday it will change the way it
sells its medium-term loans, a move that market participants say
may further erode the significance of the role of such a bond
instrument in guiding monetary policy. The central bank is
expected to inject 63 billion yuan ($8.68 billion) on a net
basis into the market on Tuesday. 
    China's sovereign bond yields were broadly down, with
10-year yields <CN240011=> dropping below 1.8%.
    The dollar index, which measures the greenback's value
versus six major currencies <=USD>, was 0.038% higher at 104.34.
    The offshore yuan traded at 7.2701 yuan per dollar, down
about 0.07% in Asian trade.
    LEVELS AT 0247 GMT

headline: 中国汇市：美指扩大反弹人民币早盘创半个月低点，CNH跌破7.27触近三周新低
News:
* 
      人民币早盘下探半个月低点后暂时企稳
    

        * 
      中间价实际值和路透预测偏离扩至近850点
    

        * 
      美元继续反弹，人民币跟随小跌
    

        * 
      4月对等关税落地前，人民币跟随美指窄幅波动
    

  

       路透上海3月25日 - 人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>周二早盘低开百点下探半个月低点，随后跌幅略有收窄，中间价四连跌刷新逾两个月新低，较路透预测偏离扩至近850点。交易员表示，美元继续反弹，人民币也跟随小幅调整，不过4月初对等关税实施前，人民币大概率跟随美元窄幅波动。
    
    “短期美元/人民币就是跟着美元走，目前看美元还是有些反弹的空间，”一中资行交易员称，“中间价也有一点点动，人民币慢慢贬。”
    
    另一外资行交易员则认为，短期美元/人民币续跌空间比较有限，稳定的汇率对稳定金融市场更有意义。
    
    
    离岸CNH<CNH=D3>短暂跌破7.27关口，创近三周新低，目前离岸汇价略低于在岸，似乎离岸的贬值预期略有升温，不过目前看离岸人民币流动性并未收紧。
    
    花旗最新观点指出，美债收益率回升是人民币承压的关键，另外日圆走弱至150关口下方，也会拖累离岸CNH；另外期权角度看，在4月2日美国新一轮关税宣布前，市场对人民币看跌的押注持续增长。
    
    招商银行金融市场部认为，近期美元反弹有经济数据、欧洲利好兑现，关税临近等因素，在下周关税落地之前，还是需要警惕美元继续反弹。“但关税是不是再被豁免和延期也存在变数，这会限制反弹的幅度。”
    
    招行并指出，要让美元指数趋势彻底反转，还是需要美国经济下行的担忧被证伪，要么政策转向，要么经济一直维持高韧性，如果都没有，美元指数则仍可能重新回归下行趋势。
    
    美国总统特朗普最新表示，很可能在4月2日实施对等征税时排除一系列针对特定行业的关税，但特朗普政府的一位官员周一警告说，情况仍可能变化，尚未做出最终决定。华尔街认为，此举表明他在这个数周以来搅动市场的问题上表现出了灵活性。
    
    “投资者对白宫发布的每一条可能影响关税讨论的新闻保持谨慎，这是可以理解的，”BMO Capital Markets 在报告称，“从这一过程中得出的最重要结论之一是，唯一确定的主题就是不确定性。”
    
    今年大部分时间里，美元一直承受着压力，市场对特朗普将迅速出台有利于增长的政策的假设转变成了对贸易关税实施和最终影响的担忧。美国商品期货交易委员会(CFTC)上周五公布的数据显示，投机客上周对美元转为净看跌，为10月以来首次。
    
    
    全球汇市方面，美元兑日圆汇率周二早盘触及三周高点，在一些强劲的美国服务业数据和关税方面的谨慎乐观情绪之后，美元全线走坚。[FRX/CN]
    
    北京时间11:46，人民币兑美元<CNY=CFXS>即期报7.2613元，盘中最低触及7.265元，创3月10日以来新低，上日收报7.252元，夜盘终报7.2605元。今日人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>报7.1788元，创1月20日以来新低，上日为7.178元。截至目前人民币即期成交量<CNYSPTVOL=CFXT>为181.65亿美元。

    海外无本金交割远期外汇(NDF)<CNYNDFOR=>市场上，美元/人民币一年期品种<CNY1YNDFOR=>最新报在7.0835元, 上日尾盘为7.08元。香港的离岸人民币兑美元即期<CNH=D3>最新报在7.2673元, 盘中最低触及7.2703元，创3月5日以来新低，当前汇价与在岸即期价差为60点，上一交易日尾盘报7.2627元。（完）
    
    相关报导：

headline: 《汇市短评》美元/人民币高歌猛进，但中国央行可能举起减速黄旗
News:
路透3月25日 - 美元兑人民币似乎处于快速上升趋势，技术图表上一路畅行无阻，可能会吸引更多买家进场。但中国央行坚持维稳人民币，可能通过口头或直接干预来缓和美元/人民币的涨势。
    
    尽管美元指数跳涨，但周二人民币兑美元中间价四连跌续创逾两个月新低，监管加码过滤举措，助力稳定市场预期。
    
    这可能使一些多头望而却步。在周一美元兑人民币突破 100 日移动均线（目前切入位在 7.2573）和去年9月至今年1月走势的 23.6% 费波纳奇回撤位（7.2545）后，这些多头蜂拥而至。看涨信号指向 7.3000 心理关口，中国央行可能选择坚守到底。
    
    虽然中国央行或缓和美元/人民币的上涨气势，但基本面对多头仍有利。中国央行意外提前预告3月中期借贷便利（MLF）操作规模，改变招标方式，标志着MLF与政策利率彻底脱钩，效果类似于结构性降息。在美国关税落地冲击前，央行释放呵护流动性信号，此前偏“鹰”政策态度有所缓和。[nL3S3Q70TB]
    
    而美国通胀风险则扩大了中美债券收益率差距，这将使美元兑人民币保持强劲。
    
    美元/人民币多头面临的风险可能来自中美贸易谈判，以及随着对中国资产的信心和2025年经济增长前景的改善，外国资本可能流入。

headline: BUZZ-COMMENT-USD/CNY gets green light, but PBOC may pull yellow flag
News:
March 25 (Reuters) - 
    USD/CNY appears to be off to the races, with green lights on
the charts that will inspire more buyers, but China's central
bank is stubbornly defending the yuan, and could verbally or
directly intervene in FX markets to slow it down.
    The People's Bank of China set Tuesday's USD/CNY benchmark
only marginally higher, despite another jump in the USD index.
The PBOC used a stronger damping factor to squash the USD/CNY
fixing, affirming its stable-yuan pledge.
That could deter some bulls who might have crowded in following
Monday's breakout above the 100-day moving average, currently at
7.2573, and the 23.6% Fibonacci retracement of the
September-January move at 7.2545. Those bullish cues point to
the 7.3000 psychological trading barrier, which the PBOC might
choose to defend.
While the central bank could slow the move higher, fundamentals
still underpin USD/CNY longs. Changes to the PBOC's medium-term
lending facility operation, while reducing its significance as a
monetary policy tool, might reaffirm an easing bias among
Chinese policymakers. The widening U.S.-China bond yield gap,
expanded by U.S. inflationary risks, should keep USD/CNY
buoyant.
Risks to USD/CNY longs might come from U.S.-China trade
negotiations, and the possibility of foreign capital inflows as
the mood improves for Chinese assets and the country's 2025
growth outlook.

headline: 中国汇市：路透测算的人民币汇率CFETS指数创半个月新高，本季迄今仍跌2.50%
News:
路透上海3月25日 - 路透根据中国外汇交易中心(CFETS)公布的中间价测算，CFETS
人民币汇率指数周二较上日微升0.05%至98.93，创3月10日以来新高；美元续震荡反弹，美
元/人民币中间价变化仍有限，使得套算的汇率指数跟随上行。SDR篮子指数微升至93.05，B
IS篮子指数微升至105.22。

    今年以来CFETS人民币汇率指数累计下跌2.50%，SDR篮子指数跌1.58%，BIS指数跌1.86%
。2024年这三个指数分别升4.16%、1.41%和4.69%。2023年这三个指数分别跌1.27%、2.97%
和1.21%，但跌幅较2022年均有收窄，2022年这三个指数分别跌3.71%、4.25%和2.80%。
    


 CFETS篮子指数前十大货币变化    今日中间价     较上日升贬
 美元/人民币<CNY=PBOC>                 7.1788  -8点(-0.01%)
 欧元/人民币<EURCNY=PBOC>              7.7864  140点(0.18%)
 日圆/人民币<JPYCNY=PBOC>              4.7886  361点(0.75%)
 港元/人民币<HKDCNY=PBOC>             0.92342  0点(0.01%)
 澳元/人民币<AUDCNY=PBOC>               4.537  -37点(-0.08%)
 新元/人民币<SGDCNY=PBOC>              5.3821  114点(0.21%)
 人民币/林吉特<CNYMYR=PBOC>           0.61583  22点(0.35%)
 人民币/泰铢<CNYTHB=PBOC>              4.6949  53点(0.11%)
 人民币/韩元<CNYKRW=PBOC>                 203  17点(0.08%)
 人民币/卢布<CNYRUB=PBOC>             11.5721  -849点(-0.73%)
    为便于市场成员和社会公众获取CFETS人民币汇率指数系列数据，自2016年2月22日起，
CFETS在中国货币网新增人民币汇率指数展示功能，并按周和按月发布人民币汇率指数数据
。

    2016年底CFETS进行首次货币篮子规则调整，CFETS篮子货币数量由13种调升为24种，同
时调整了相关货币权重；SDR篮子也调整了货币权重，并与CFETS货币篮子均重新定基，重新
定基日为2016年最后一个交易日。

    2019年底开始交易中心每年年末都对CFETS指数进行权重微调和重新定基，此举旨在进
一步增强指数的代表性。2024年底交易中心将CFETS指数货币篮子和权重都进行调整，篮子
货币总数增至25个。[nL4S3NW0I5]

    2022年底外汇交易中心对SDR指数货币权重进行微调。2019年底对BIS指数货币权重进行
微调；2023年底对BIS指数货币篮子和权重都进行了调整，BIS篮子货币数量调整为43种。（
完）

headline: 中国汇市：人民币兑美元中间价四连跌续创逾两个月新低，监管加码过滤助稳预期
News:
路透上海3月25日 - 人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>周二报7.1788元，较上日的7.1780元小跌8点，创1月20日以来新低，和路透预测偏离扩至近850点；美元重新反弹，人民币面临的外部压力有所上升，监管层也加码了过滤举措，助力稳定市场预期。
    
    人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>上日收盘报7.2520元，夜盘终报7.2605元。离岸人民币即期<CNH=D3>最新报7.2668元，上日收盘在7.2627元。稍早前路透测算今日人民币中间价大概会开在7.2630元附近，较上日贬值约850点，“逆周期因子”暂未发生作用。
    
    
    美国总统特朗普最新表示，很可能在4月2日实施对等征税时排除一系列针对特定行业的关税，但特朗普政府的一位官员周一警告说，情况仍可能变化，尚未做出最终决定。华尔街认为，此举表明他在这个数周以来搅动市场的问题上表现出了灵活性。
    
    “投资者对白宫发布的每一条可能影响关税讨论的新闻保持谨慎，这是可以理解的，”BMO Capital Markets 在报告称，“从这一过程中得出的最重要结论之一是，唯一确定的主题就是不确定性。”
    
    
    今年大部分时间里，美元一直承受着压力，市场对特朗普将迅速出台有利于增长的政策的假设转变成了对贸易关税实施和最终影响的担忧。美国商品期货交易委员会(CFTC) 上周五公布的数据显示，投机客上周对美元转为净看跌，为10月以来首次。
    
    全球汇市方面，美元指数<.DXY>周二亚洲早盘继续维持在104.30上方交投，特朗普的关税有些灵活的可能性，这缓和了市场谨慎情绪，但不确定性仍较大。[FRX/CN](完)

    人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>上日收盘报7.2520元，夜盘终报7.2605元。离岸人民币即期<CNH=D3>最新报7.2668元，上日收盘在7.2627元。稍早前路透测算今日人民币中间价大概会开在7.2630元附近，较上日贬值约850点，“逆周期因子”暂未发生作用。
    
    
    美国总统特朗普最新表示，很可能在4月2日实施对等征税时排除一系列针对特定行业的关税，但特朗普政府的一位官员周一警告说，情况仍可能变化，尚未做出最终决定。华尔街认为，此举表明他在这个数周以来搅动市场的问题上表现出了灵活性。
    
    “投资者对白宫发布的每一条可能影响关税讨论的新闻保持谨慎，这是可以理解的，”BMO Capital Markets 在报告称，“从这一过程中得出的最重要结论之一是，唯一确定的主题就是不确定性。”
    
    
    今年大部分时间里，美元一直承受着压力，市场对特朗普将迅速出台有利于增长的政策的假设转变成了对贸易关税实施和最终影响的担忧。美国商品期货交易委员会(CFTC) 上周五公布的数据显示，投机客上周对美元转为净看跌，为10月以来首次。
    
    全球汇市方面，美元指数<.DXY>周二亚洲早盘继续维持在104.30上方交投，特朗普的关税有些灵活的可能性，这缓和了市场谨慎情绪，但不确定性仍较大。[FRX/CN](完)

headline: 路透测算的人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>今日料开在7.2630元附近
News:
路透上海3月25日 - 路透根据中国外汇交易中心(CFETS)公布的人民币汇率形成机制测算，人民币兑美元中间价<CNY=PBOC>周二预计会开在7.2630元附近，较上日贬值约850点。
    
    隔夜美国经济数据向好叠加特朗普可能对关税采取灵活态度，美元继续反弹，人民币的外部压力重新累积，国内监管层料加大对人民币单边贬值预期的过滤举措，助力稳定市场预期。

    上日人民币兑美元即期<CNY=CFXS>收报7.252元，而中间价则为7.178元。根据定价机制，今日中间价变动中，有740点下跌反映市场供求影响，另有110点下跌反映的是隔夜一篮子汇率基本保持不变所需要的点数；“逆周期因子”暂未发生作用。

    路透测算的上日人民币兑美元中间价为7.2496元，和外汇交易中心公布的实际值偏差716点。上日路透根据CFETS公布的中间价测算，人民币汇率CFETS指数、参考SDR（特别提款权）篮子指数和参考BIS(国际清算银行)篮子指数分别为98.88、92.94和105.12。

    上日(截至北京时间次日凌晨3点)人民币兑美元即期累计成交量<CNYSPTVOL=CFXT>为421.32亿美元。

    2016年2月以来中国初步形成“收盘汇率+一篮子货币汇率变化”的人民币对美元汇率中间价形成机制，2017年2月将中间价对一篮子货币的参考时段由24小时调整为15小时，5月底外汇市场自律机制汇率工作组在中间价报价模型中引入“逆周期因子”。

    在2018年初自律机制建议各报价行“可以调整”报价模型中的“逆周期系数”，使其恢复中性；6月起人民币快速下跌，市场贬值预期再起，8月24日自律机制称重启逆周期因子。2020年10月部分报价行将逆周期因子淡出使用。(完)

 (发稿 张金栋；审校 张喜良)
 ((Jindong.Zhang@thomsonreuters.com; +86 21 20830168; Reuters Messaging:
Jindong.Zhang.thomsonreuters.com@thomsonreuters.net))

headline: 《汇市简讯》亚洲前瞻：聚焦市场对美股反弹和日圆疲软的反应
News:
路透3月25日 - 特朗普称汽车关税即将来临，但并非所有新关税都将在4月2日宣布，这在周一受到了投资者的欢迎。美国3月企业活动有所增加，但信心进一步恶化。

    华尔街和美国公债收益率上升，美元在日圆走软的带动下走高，大宗商品收盘涨跌不一。
    
    亚洲市场获得利好指引，新兴市场ETF上涨0.44%。数据面清淡，日本央行将公布 1 月 23-24 日政策会议记录。市场焦点将集中在该地区对华尔街反弹和日圆疲软的反应上。
    
    道指收涨1.42%，标普500指数收涨1.76%，纳指涨2.27%，受Nvidia和特斯拉的逢低买盘提振，这得益于特朗普政府可能对美国贸易伙伴的关税采取更温和措施的迹象。

    美国公债收益率攀升，两年期公债收益率上升 9 个基点至 4.039%，10 年期公债收益率上升 8 个基点至 4.337%，30 年期公债收益率上升 7 个基点至 4.666%，原因是市场预期下周特朗普将宣布的一系列关税造成的冲击可能比预期要小。

    油价上涨，特朗普表示将对从委内瑞拉购买石油和天然气的国家征收25%的关税，布兰特和美国原油上涨1.25%。美国期铜跌0.55%，金价跌0.4%，受美元走强以及特朗普暗示在关税问题上有一定灵活性的影响。
    
    美元 <=USD> 上扬 0.25%，其中美元/日圆上涨 0.9%，受美国公债收益率走高推动。欧元跌0.1%，英镑涨0.05%，美元/离岸人民币涨0.05%，澳元涨0.2%，新西兰元跌0.05%，美元/加元跌0.3%。
    
    纽约时段下午 5 时，比特币上涨 2.15%，报 87,939 美元。

headline: BUZZ-Asia Day Ahead-Response to higher Wall Street, weak yen leads
News:
March 25 (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump's auto tariffs are
coming, but not all levies will be imposed on April 2, which was well received
by investors on Monday. U.S. business activity climbed in March, but sentiment
deteriorated. 
    Wall Street and Treasury yields rose, the U.S. dollar edged higher, led by
yen weakness, and commodities closed mixed. 
    A positive lead for Asian markets, with EM ETFs up 0.44%. There is a light
second-tier regional data schedule, while the Bank of Japan will release the
minutes of its January 23-24 policy meeting. The focus will be on the regional
response to Wall Street's bounce and yen weakness.
    Dow +1.42%, S&P +1.76%, and Nasdaq +2.27% led by bargain-hunting in Nvidia
and Tesla amid signs the Trump administration might take a more measured
approach on tariffs.
    Treasury yields climbed, 2yr +9bp to 4.039%, 10yr +8bp to 4.337%, and 30yr
+7bp to 4.666%, as markets priced expectations of lower U.S. tariffs. 
    Oil rose as Trump plans a 25% tariff on countries that buy Venezuelan oil or
gas, Brent and WTI +1.25%. U.S. copper -0.55% and gold -0.4%, capped by the
firmer USD, and Trump hints at some flexibility regarding tariffs. 
    The U.S. dollar <=USD> firmed 0.25%, led by USD/JPY +0.9% driven by higher
UST yields. EUR -0.1%, GBP +0.05%, USD/CNH +0.05%, AUD +0.2%, NZD -0.05%, and
USD/CAD -0.3%.
    Bitcoin traded 2.15% higher at $87,939 at 5 pm in New York.

headline: BUZZ-FX options wrap - Month-end USD boost is unpursued
News:
Renewed demand for the USD is being fuelled by month and quarter-end FX
rebalancing flows, according to bank models, especially versus the EUR. However,
while the options market recognises the short term risk for USD gains, traders
aren't aggressively renewing long USD call positions. 
    EUR/USD options epitomise the situation, with light demand and increased
premiums for shorter-dated expiry downside strike options, while longer-term
expiry options maintain a bias toward further gains toward 1.1500. 
    G10 FX option implied volatility remains generally subdued following
declines from the early-to-mid March highs. This trend is typical in an
environment where FX spot markets are consolidating, and risk appetite is not
significantly weak.
    That's been the case in USD/JPY as the spot market recovered from March 11
lows since October at 146.55, pressuring benchmark 1-month implied volatility
back to the lower 9s and the downside over upside strike on 1-month 25 delta
risk reversals to 1.3 from 1.85. Demand from the lower levels remains limited
and there hasn't been any stand-out demand or supply for strikes in either
direction. 
    However, tariff uncertainties persist and there are more economic data
releases looming, which should help to limit deeper G10 FX implied volatility
setbacks.
    There are many large strikes expiring this week and related hedging flows
may have more influence in quieter FX markets.   
          
  
    For more click on [FXBUZ]
